intro: Salpinctes kalmiifolius, commonly known as the Kalm's false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, dark green leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to greenish flowers in early spring, followed by reddish-brown berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardens.
